title: Parts of spack break when using spack built python
body:
Parts of URL processing breaks when using a spack built python. I am not sure if the issue is related specifically to spack built python or if other variants of python exhibit the same issue. The affected parts of spack are `spack checksum`, `spack versions`, and `spack fetch` with #1346.

Here is an example with r-jsonlite. First, with the system python on a `CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core)` system.

```
module list
No modules loaded

spack versions r-jsonlite
==> Safe versions (already checksummed):
  0.9.21
==> Remote versions (not yet checksummed):
  1.0     0.9.20  0.9.18  0.9.16  0.9.14  0.9.12  0.9.10  0.9.8  0.9.6  0.9.4  0.9.1
  0.9.22  0.9.19  0.9.17  0.9.15  0.9.13  0.9.11  0.9.9   0.9.7  0.9.5  0.9.3  0.9.0
```

Now, load the spack built python.

```
module load python/2.7.12-gcc-4.8.5-mhb6rhl 
Autoloading bzip2/1.0.6-gcc-4.8.5-rgrn5su
Autoloading ncurses/6.0-gcc-4.8.5-jelh6yx
Autoloading zlib/1.2.8-gcc-4.8.5-7qfsb3e
Autoloading openssl/1.0.2h-gcc-4.8.5-xoai5al
Autoloading sqlite/3.8.5-gcc-4.8.5-siwv5j5
Autoloading readline/6.3-gcc-4.8.5-5upu5tz

spack versions r-jsonlite
==> Safe versions (already checksummed):
  0.9.21
==> Remote versions (not yet checksummed):
  Found no versions for r-jsonlite
```

Not having the python dependencies in the environment, with only python loaded, yields the same results. Unloading the python module restores proper functionality. This issue is related to #1225.
